intro: Kosteletzkya diplocrater var. diplocrater, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, often growing along shorelines and in brackish environments. Its structure includes a woody stem with alternate, ovate leaves that have a waxy surface. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate harsh coastal conditions.
